issues.title: Background and foreground colors do not have a sufficient contrast ratio.
issues.description: Low-contrast text is difficult or impossible for many users to read. [Learn how to provide sufficient color contrast](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/color-contrast).

issues.title: Documents must have <title> element to aid in navigation
issues.description: Ensure each HTML document contains a non-empty <title> element

any.message: Document does not have a non-empty <title> element

nodes.failureSummary:
Fix any of the following:
  Document does not have a non-empty <title> element

issues.title: A title should be provided for the document, using a non-empty title element in the head section.
issues.description:
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
   ...</head>

original_issue.message: A title should be provided for the document, using a non-empty title element in the head section.

issues.title: Document doesn't have a `<title>` element
issues.description: The title gives screen reader users an overview of the page, and search engine users rely on it heavily to determine if a page is relevant to their search. [Learn more about document titles](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/document-title).

node.explanation:
Fix any of the following:
  Document does not have a non-empty <title> element

automatic.name: Headings; Wrong Order, Empty & Missing Headings;

issues.title: Heading levels should only increase by one
issues.description: Ensure the order of headings is semantically correct

nodes.failureSummary:
Fix any of the following:
  Heading order invalid

issues.title: Heading elements are not in a sequentially-descending order
issues.description: Properly ordered headings that do not skip levels convey the semantic structure of the page, making it easier to navigate and understand when using assistive technologies. [Learn more about heading order](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/heading-order).

node.explanation:
Fix any of the following:
  Heading order invalid

issues.title: Links must be distinguishable without relying on color
issues.description: Ensure links are distinguished from surrounding text in a way that does not rely on color

any.message: The link has insufficient color contrast of 1.28:1 with the surrounding text. (Minimum contrast is 3:1, link text: #5a329d, surrounding text: #3a3a3a)

relatedNodes.html:
Charlotte Area Guide is brought to you by ASC.
Copyright Â© 2023, Arts and Science Council. All rights reserved.
Site developed by Zero Defect Design LLC.

any.message: The link has no styling (such as underline) to distinguish it from the surrounding text

nodes.failureSummary:
Fix any of the following:
  The link has insufficient color contrast of 1.28:1 with the surrounding text. (Minimum contrast is 3:1, link text: #5a329d, surrounding text: #3a3a3a)
  The link has no styling (such as underline) to distinguish it from the surrounding text

issues.title: Links rely on color to be distinguishable.
issues.description: Low-contrast text is difficult or impossible for many users to read. Link text that is discernible improves the experience for users with low vision. [Learn how to make links distinguishable](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/link-in-text-block).

node.explanation:
Fix any of the following:
  The link has insufficient color contrast of 1.28:1 with the surrounding text. (Minimum contrast is 3:1, link text: #5a329d, surrounding text: #3a3a3a)
  The link has no styling (such as underline) to distinguish it from the surrounding text

automatic.name: Size; Target Size; Element too small

issues.title: Touch targets do not have sufficient size or spacing.
issues.description: Touch targets with sufficient size and spacing help users who may have difficulty targeting small controls to activate the targets. [Learn more about touch targets](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/target-size).

node.explanation:
Fix any of the following:
  Target has insufficient size (67.6px by 17px, should be at least 24px by 24px)
  Target has insufficient space to its closest neighbors. Safe clickable space has a diameter of 0px instead of at least 24px.
